review: This room was the bomb. I went with my co-workers as a team event, so we were able to fit 16 of us comfortably in there. None of the teams made it out, but it was super close! I loved how my team was working on one clue for a hot minute and we had read the clue "upside down" and one of the employees told us to take a closer look to make sure we were right....they nudged us enough to understand we had read the clue wrong but never gave the answer away. I would absolutely come back- so fun and it felt exciting to be in volcano *-*

room_description: Description:At Escape Narrative, the room starts with a strong story that causes the situational stress and barriers, and the puzzles occur organically from that story arc. When a team leaves they should be talking about the story, not just about the puzzles.

review: First time to do a escape room. Six of us decided to try this for entertainment and it was great. Not just going around a room and finding keys. We had to think, use clues, use a computer, put puzzles together and search as a team. The owner was just great and very nice. Explained everything very well. Exciting and thought provoking.

room_description: Description:Upon escaping the Crimson Storm, you and your crew have found yourselves adrift and come across the mysterious ship known as The Emerald Seas. Legends tell that this ship was cursed when its crew mutinied and traded their captain's heart for unknown treasures. Witnesses say the ship only appears for an hour before sinking below the water. You and your crew board the ship in hopes of dispelling the curse and claim the ship as your own before it returns to the watery depths.
room_address: 4700 N Central Ave, Suite 102 Phoenix, AZ 85012 (Show on map)

review: My family visited Phoenix Escape Room at the recommendation of a friend. Our ages varied from 6-46 -- and we all had an amazing time. The whole experience was really well done. I'd recommend them in a second.
room_title: Escape room "Curse on the Emerald Seas" by The Puzzle Effect in Phoenix
room_description: Description:Upon escaping the Crimson Storm, you and your crew have found yourselves adrift and come across the mysterious ship known as The Emerald Seas. Legends tell that this ship was cursed when its crew mutinied and traded their captain's heart for unknown treasures. Witnesses say the ship only appears for an hour before sinking below the water. You and your crew board the ship in hopes of dispelling the curse and claim the ship as your own before it returns to the watery depths.
room_address: 4700 N Central Ave, Suite 102 Phoenix, AZ 85012 (Show on map)

review: I just finished their two new rooms, The Path and Curse on the Emerald Sea, at their new location and I must say that they were both quite well done and very indicative of the care they put into the business. Both rooms had great set designs, ambiance, and the puzzles were creative and, excluding one that I just wasn't getting for a bit, just the right side of difficult but achievable. I want to also praise the staff, they were all friendly and funny and each had their own unique style that I think really brings an air of friendliness to the business that you don't see in a lot of escape rooms. They clearly care about you having a good time. If you're looking for something to do I really recommend giving these rooms a try, where else can you find yourself in the hold of a ship, a zen garden, search for a magical creature, and help save a city in one day? Go, go do it now.
room_title: Escape room "Curse on the Emerald Seas" by The Puzzle Effect in Phoenix

review: My daughter and I had a great time at this place.  We had so much fun solving the riddles that we went back and did another room.  We really enjoyed working with the other people to figure out the riddles and unlock the clues.  It was really fun and interesting.

review: We went to the new location (and newly renamed) Puzzle Effect and found the same Top Notch customer service as the original location. The manager, Marian, who was also our gamemaster, was super nice and welcoming. We did the Pipe Works, which turned out to be a good, solid escape room. This room could be divided into 2 teams racing against each other, or as we did it, one team. This was a fun room, run by a fun staff. Marian was a great gamemaster, and she knew exactly when we needed nudges and help. (Thx, Marian!) We highly recommend this location to beginners and experienced gamers alike.

review: We had such a great time doing the millionaires loft here!  We have done escape rooms in multiple cities around the US and this was one of the best!  The staff made us feel so welcome and made sure we had a great time!  The room was very unique and challenging and we were able to finish it with only a minute to spare. We used a couple hints and they were well thought out giving just enough to point us in the right direction but not just giving away free information. I recommend this place to anyone that enjoys an hour of great family friendly fun!  We will definitely be back to try the other rooms!
room_title: Escape room "The Millionaire's Loft" by Escape House Mesa in Phoenix
room_description: Description:You are loft-sitting for your Uncle who is out of town. The maintenance crew is coming in to change the cameras. Since the cameras will be off for the next hour, your uncle wants you to sit in his loft until they are back online. Rumor has it, he stores a lot of cash in the room. Can you find his loot before the cameras come back on?
room_address: 3460 E Southern Ave #110, Mesa, AZ 85204 (Show on map)

review: Had a great experience at the Escape House Mesa! Did the Millionaire's Lounge and escaped with 8 minutes left! The staff was AWESOME!! I highly recommend escaping or trying to escape from their rooms!! We had a blast and are looking forward to escaping their other rooms soon!!!
room_title: Escape room "The Millionaire's Loft" by Escape House Mesa in Phoenix

review: We had a great anniversary at Escape House Mesa. One of the owners, Adam, was our gamemaster, and he showed us a super time. (Thanks, Adam!) We did "The Millionaire's Loft" and had a blast! Adam gave us just the right amount of help when needed. We escaped with 38 seconds left. We had such fun, we signed up for "The Detective's Office" immediately afterward. We can't wait to do "Flood the City". I would say that this business is a "must-do" escape room experience for newbies and experienced pros alike. If you like puzzles, you will like Escape House Mesa.

review: My husband and I have done over 20 different escape rooms within Phoenix and Pittsburgh.  Runestone is definitely one of our favorites!  First of all we were blown away by the lobby.  Not at all what I was expecting to find next to the discout movie theater!  It is gorgeous and looks really upscale.  We enjoyed the room itself, Runestone.  It had a nice mixture of different types of puzzles and our clue master was great.  Can't wait to go back and try one of the other rooms!
room_title: Escape room "Runestone" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
room_description:
Description:The sacred Runestones have been discovered stolen and replaced by a series of impressive illusions. Without knowledge of their whereabouts or those responsible, the Council feared the Runestones would soon be used against the good men, women, and children of the realm. Through meditation, the Council managed to pinpoint the Stones’ energy to a precise location, but the knowledge gained was no less comforting.
Their fears became apparent upon learning that the dreaded and powerful wizard, known as Vayce, took possession of the stolen Runestones. With the help of the Runestones' colossal energy, Vayce prepares to extinguish the sun and all life with it. More concerning is that they fear Vayce may very well be invested into this atrocity.
Recover the sacred Runestones and return them to their correct position before Vayce succeeds in casting his final spell plunging the world into eternal darkness.
room_address: 2710 W Bell Road, Suite 1200, Phoenix, AZ 85053 (Show on map)

review: Amazing experience! We went tonight as a family and went through Runestone and I was fantastic. We've been to loads of other escape rooms and this was by FAR the best! It can be difficult but it is a challenging and rewarding experience! I can't wait to go to their other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Shed" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
room_description:
Description:You met with your friends for a late night showing of a movie. There were few people around as you entered the smallish theater. The film started. About ten minutes in, one of your friends asked “Do you smell something?” That is the last thing you remember.

You and your friends woke up locked in a shed. Obviously, it has been used to keep people locked in before. You sense someone watching you from the darkness.

Suddenly there is a yelp! A waft of burnt hair comes from the dark room. Your kidnapper runs out in a hurry. You sense he was not done locking you in. You rise up, sensing if he is back, he can keep you there for a long time.
room_address: 9875 S Priest Dr #101 Tempe, AZ 85284 (Show on map)

review: So much Fun and well crafted rooms.
room_title: Escape room "The Shed" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
room_description:
Description:You met with your friends for a late night showing of a movie. There were few people around as you entered the smallish theater. The film started. About ten minutes in, one of your friends asked “Do you smell something?” That is the last thing you remember.

You and your friends woke up locked in a shed. Obviously, it has been used to keep people locked in before. You sense someone watching you from the darkness.

Suddenly there is a yelp! A waft of burnt hair comes from the dark room. Your kidnapper runs out in a hurry. You sense he was not done locking you in. You rise up, sensing if he is back, he can keep you there for a long time.
room_address: 9875 S Priest Dr #101 Tempe, AZ 85284 (Show on map)

review: Great experience. Most definitely will go back!

review: 5/5 stars for Escape:Chandler! We’ve done The Cabin and The Pawn Shop. Both rooms are immersive and have great designs. It’s clear the owners put much thought into their themes and room decoration. The owners also exude passion for what they do and make the experience even better. The puzzles flow well and are fun to solve. I would recommend this place to anyone. Thanks for the great time!
room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by ESCAPE:chandler in Phoenix
room_description:
Description:Your camping vacation has turned bad. You wake up in the middle of the night and find one of your friends is missing. You follow a faint trail of blood to a remote cabin in the woods and soon discover something is horribly wrong there.
You try to call the police, but quickly realize you have no phone service this deep in the woods. Desperation sets in as you know that finding a way to get help may be your only means of survival! ​ You have one hour to save your friend and yourselves... before the cabin's resident returns, or you all may perish!
room_address: 312 N Alma School Rd, Suite 9, Chandler, AZ 85224 (Show on map)

review: Just spent a fun hour here. The Cabin is just the right amount of spooky and creepy suspense. The owner/gamemaster was so good at her job, so we felt the experience was amazing. We will be back!

review: Had the pleasure of doing The Legend Of The 7th Stone and it was amazing!  Really one of the best escape rooms I have had the pleasure of experiencing.  Everything was top notch from the immersive theme to the helpful and energetic staff.  We made it out with a little more than 14 minutes to spare.  I honestly cannot wait to come back and try Great Outdoors!  Thanks for an amazing time!
room_title: Escape room "The Legend of the 7th Stone" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
room_description:
Description:According to a legend, one of the pharaohs of ancient Egypt was on a quest of searching for seven mysterious stones. He intended to construct a device that would have the power to change the world. However, he never completed the search and the stones were long forgotten. Until recently...
Dr. Cornelius Carter believes he has uncovered new findings about the pharaoh and his stones. He was able to locate the pyramid where the stones are supposedly located but never made it back from the expedition.
Equipped with 60 minutes of oxygen you must enter the pyramid, find Dr. Carter and complete his mission. Can you uncover the secrets of Abydos?
room_address: 42302 N Vision Way, Suite 104, Anthem, AZ 85086 (Show on map)

review: This is a great place to go for all ages! I've done 2 of their rooms with my 8 year old son and both were challenging but FUN! We did The Principal's Office and The Legend of the 7th Stone. If you have kids hen you have to book the whole room but the flat rate to book it as a private room is reasonable. The staff has always been kind and friendly. We will definitely be back!

It is tough to make the drive all the way out to Mesa, but we will definitely be back to collect the rest of those bracelets!

The three people I was with were new to escape rooms. It said medium difficulty. A very well thought out room. We will be back soon to do the carn-evil room.

review: Our group of 6 did the Wicked Witch (Oz) room. This was our first time at Eludesions and we had heard that in Arizona, they probably average the largest sized rooms. It didn't disappoint! The design, props, decoration, and interactive puzzles we're very fun, tricky, and unique. We were definitely helped by our game master, as we got stuck in a couple parts, which after receiving a clue, it all made sense. So if you're used to letter locks and combo locks, you'll be challenged in this room. I would definitely recommend this room! The staff were very laid back and fun. Also, I spoke with a female staff member over the phone regarding a question I had, and she was very helpful in helping me find an answer. Then to my surprise, Bob the owner, calls me back regarding this question, and clarified the answer. He's definitely someone who's business I would like to support. Very generous gentleman, and I appreciate his customer service and business acumen. Our group will definitely come back to try all of the rooms at Eludesions (we learned it's pronounced like "illusions").
room_title: Escape room "Wicked Witch's Castle" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
room_description:
Description:The Wicked Witch has hidden the Tin Man's heart, the Scarecrow's diploma, the Lion's medal, and the magical slippers. According to the legend, Dorothy should be emerging from her battered home any minute. You must locate all of the items and return them to their rightful place or the story will be altered and the Wicked Witch will be able to trap Dorothy in Oz forever.
The Witch was last spotted in the Haunted Forest, so we suggest that would be the best place for your journey to begin. Please hurry, you must prevail before the hourglass runs empty!
room_address: 2710 W Bell Road, Suite 1200, Phoenix, AZ 85053 (Show on map)

review: Me and my wife had the pleasure of experiencing not one but two rooms here. We loved the first room so much (Wicked Witches Castle) that we wanted to do another one right after (Runestone). Both rooms had fantastic set designs and the puzzles were unique and definitely generation 3. Both of our game masters, Ahmed and Kyle were great as well. We will definitely be returning to do their other two rooms soon!

room_description:
Description:It’s a matter of balance. It’s a matter of peace. It’s a matter of finding a sense of self, calm and serenity in a space that may not otherwise provide it. Welcome to Ying Yang where everything is black and white - except for your decisions. 

While time seems like an illusion, you only have 60 minutes. A simple box is your goal. Stay focused on the path in front of you and slowly, one foot in front of the other, you will find the answers you’re looking for. Simple means easy, right? You’ll be surprised….

review: I took my daughter and three friends here for one of their escape rooms last night, and they had a great time. The Detention room was challenging, fun, and a great theme for kids (based on their words, since I didn't go in). Garret and Jesse were just amazing. I waited in the lobby while the girls were in the room, and between customers, the guys kept me company and then let the girls continue the room passed their time limit since no other customers were waiting. They were great with my group and from what I overheard, great with every other group. Super friendly and funny. They treat their customers like friends, which is perfect in that type of environment. Genuinely awesome guys, and even though I don't live in the area, I'll be returning just because of them.

review: Dynamic Escape Rooms has come up with a great game idea. An escape room with varying degrees of challenges. You can chose medium, hard, or extreme depending on how experienced or brave you are! And apparently even if you chose one style one time, when you come back to do another style, you don't play it the same way, so it's almost like a completely different room. We chose the medium Deja Vu and it was just right for us. You don't have to be a Doctor Who fan to do this room. It just adds to the fun and the geekiness if you are. You don't even have to be a sci-fi fan to enjoy this room. The decor is great and It was a very fun experience. Our gamemasters were Ignacio and Adam. Ignacio knew exactly when to give nudges and hints, making him one of the best gamemasters we have ever had. (Thx, Ignacio!) Also, Adam is one of the best front lobby people. He is also available on the website for a chat if you have questions. (Thx, Adam!) If you want to play a private room, you don't need to "buy out" the rest of the spots. You only pay $30 extra to make it yours alone! The lobby and restrooms were clean and uncluttered. This room would appeal to all ages, sci-fi fans, Doctor Who fans, puzzle fans, game fans. In other words, if you like escape games, we recommend this business to anybody and everybody, travelers and locals alike!
room_title: Escape room "The Time Machine: Deja Vu" by Dynamic Escape Rooms in Phoenix
room_description: Description:During your extended vacation on present-day Earth, you've been posing as a medicine man to get away from the chaos of the universe, but your vacation is about to suddenly come to an end. An unexpected message arrives from somewhere in time requesting your urgent assistance. A close friend is in grave danger and time is running out. Can you decipher the message before it's too late?
room_address: 1797 W University Dr, Suite 168, Tempe AZ 85281 (Show on map)

review: This was my first ‘escape room’ experience and the team at Dynamic Escape Rooms have set the bar very high. Initially I wasn’t thrilled with the idea of being locked in a room and forced to escape, but was immediately comforted by the amazing staff that assured me that this wasn’t the typical escape room. I could leave and take a break as needed, the door wasn’t locked, and to think of it as an interactive experience instead. And it was just that. I was amazed at the complexity and range of the puzzles in the room and the imaginative story line that linked the entire experience together. I first played at the medium level of the Time Machine Game, my team and I barely completed it on time, but felt we could definitely complete the hard level now that we were familiar with the layout. We couldn’t have been more wrong. I was amazed at how much more complex and different the puzzles had become with a change in levels, needles to say we did not complete the level on time. I will definitely be back and will be recommending Dynamic Escape Rooms to all of my friends. Great Job Dynamic!!!
room_title: Escape room "The Time Machine: Deja Vu" by Dynamic Escape Rooms in Phoenix

review: WOW! What an amazing experience! I have been waiting for so long for a great escape room experience. The room can be set at different levels, I can't wait to go back and try a harder level! I definitely recommend checking out Dynamic Escape Rooms to all looking for a fun and immersive challenge! Great job Dynamic Escape Rooms staff and creators can't wait to go back!

review: These rooms are fantastic. They are well thought out, challenging, and rewarding. Captain Lockjaw, Madame Lumina, and the Pearled Pachyderm are really great for first timers or experienced puzzle room fans. The Beta Lab room is simply challenging - no antics, no frills, just boxes, locks, and puzzles so I don't recommend it for people looking for the more engaging/ theatrical experience. All in all, we were thrilled with all of these rooms and would gladly revisit if and when a new room is created.

review: Great addition to the mall! Tons of parking and food options available. Make a night of it! Some of the toughest and coolest looking rooms around!

review: My girlfriend and I came here and did the room called "The Theatre." Our cluemaster Asher did an excellent job of letting us go through the room but giving us help when we needed it, allowing for it to be challenging but still really fun so we could finish the room with 7 minutes to spare. We'd love to go back at some point and do the other rooms, as the rest of the staff was great too.

review: We've done a lot of escape rooms around the valley, but Dare to Escape's rooms are by far the best! Cult of Mithras and X-Child (which we broke the records on!) utilized the most creative puzzles, riddles, and devices that our group has encountered in AZ. Some of the secrets in the rooms actually left us with a sense of awe and wonder! I'd say the rooms strike the perfect balance between making you think outside the box and communicate with your team while avoiding frustrating, ridiculously-hard and obscure problems that are impossible to solve. Loved the themes of the rooms as well and can't wait to return for The Cell! These are the best escape rooms in AZ that we've encountered and I would definitely recommend them to anyone!
room_title: Escape room "X-Child" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
room_description:
Description:Telepathy Acclimation Program, or TAP, was a programme set up to train potential human telepaths. Children who showed telepathic potential were sent to Station Zero, a facility located deep in Mojave Desert for training.You were one of the children who was sent to this facility. In reality, they did physical and psychological experiments on you and other children.
The facility was closed down, and your memories of the place is hazy. After years of searching, you and a group of TAP victims were finally able to locate the now-abandoned facility. Some old systems are still active though. As soon as you enter the facility, it goes into a lockdown...
room_address: 9875 S Priest Dr #101 Tempe, AZ 85284 (Show on map)

review: If you've never done an escape room, do it! This was my first one. We had such a great time we came back later that night. And then booked the third room two days later. Recommend starting with Mithras and then X Child. Haven't done the cell yet. That's tomorrow!! Nice to talk to one of the owners -- local boys and their own ideas. Love that!! Great customer service and fantastic experience.

review: This is an amazing place! Great for everyone. We did the cell block. It was really fun. We had four people and barely made it out in time. A lot of good puzzles. Some really simple and some difficult. The customer service here is top notch. I love hay they say we want y'all to have fun. It's not like other escape rooms where they take pride in you not finishing. They want you to succeed.
room_title: Escape room "The Cell Block" by Cluemaster Escape Rooms in Phoenix
room_description: Description:You’ve been sentenced to execution for crimes you didn’t commit. Warden Shaw will seal your fate in 60 minutes – unless you can escape.

review: The cell was so fun and creative - my 3rd escape room and the best yet! The hosts were fantastic- we will go back and try another room.

room_description: Description:Your team of Players must enter Cyberdyne System’s Headquarters. They will receive a message from the rebellion. To save mankind from the machines, players must complete several objectives. First, inject a computer virus into the heart of Cyberdyne Systems. Lastly, players will have to activate the internal laser devices to melt down the last remaining Endoskeleton, in turn saving humanity from extinction.

Thank you for providing a fun at times stressful 55 minutes of an exciting time! We'll definitely be back to try the other rooms!

review: This was an amazing experience! My wife and I happened to walk by it and she said jokingly "want to do an escape room?". Without hesitation I said yes and in we went. It is by far the most decorated escape room we've seen to date. The two hosts were incredibly friendly. We choose the amazon plane crash room. The decoration and the detail were incredible! It was mildly difficult. My wife and I completed it with 10 minutes to spare. We can't wait to try the other one!! You will not Be disappointed with this escape room! Well done!
room_title: Escape room "Amazon Rainforest" by International Room Escape AZ in Phoenix
room_description: Description:You and your team of researchers have recently made tremendous strides in the ﬁeld of gene therapy. Deep within the Ecuadorian rainforest you discovered a miraculous rose that some believe could extend a person’s life indeﬁnitely. However, trouble ensues on the ﬂight home and you are forced to make a crash landing. Your crew makes it out safely, but the roses are gone.  Now you have one hour to exit the plane, ﬁnd the roses and make it to the rescue coordinates. Work fast and together, or the secret to immortality will be lost... forever...
room_address: 1166 S Gilbert Rd #105 Gilbert, AZ 85296 (Show on map)

review: After doing now 60 escape rooms, the Amazon room is definitely one the neatest set designs I have seen so far. You can definitely tell that a lot of work went into it to make it as immersive as possible. Please take note though that I played with 2 other people and some of the puzzles would be easier to achieve with 1 or maybe two more people. Also attention to detail is needed for this room as it is easy to miss items you are needing to find in order to do some of the puzzles. Our game master Aly was fun and refreshingly enthusiastic! Thank you for the fun experience!
room_title: Escape room "Amazon Rainforest" by International Room Escape AZ in Phoenix

review: *I am an internationally experienced Escape Room enthusiast with hundreds of rooms under my belt*These wonderful owners have created some beautiful rooms here. They are quite deserving of their High Production Value/Immersive award that they won for their Amazon Rainforest room. From start to finish, that room was one of my all-time favorites. So much attention to detail and overall fun. And the price is even lower than other Escape Rooms. Their Gravitational Effect room was a step-down in puzzle quality, though the interior design was still above-average. I especially enjoyed the physical dynamic in the middle room. Gift shops usually put me off, but in the lobby you can buy beautiful flowers hand-made by the owner. It was a nice touch.Games played: Amazon Rainforest, Gravitational Effect

review: Had an awesome time! Bill and Ted’s most excellent adventure! Highly recommend it.
room_title: Escape room "Bill and Ted's Excellent Escape Room" by Escape Westgate in Phoenix
room_description: Description:Bill and Ted have taken a wild joyride into the future. Guests will soon learn that the time machine (phone booth) has lost power due to a damaged antenna and has become trapped between the walls of a mad scientist known as “The Collector”. Being a doer of evil deeds, he now has learned the secrets of Time Travel and used it to capture the life forces of the world’s most influential figures thus changing the course of history forever! Players will have to fix the damaged antennae, find a way to power-up the Time machine and release the captured life forces of Genghis Khan, Abe Lincoln, Socrates, Napoleon and our beloved Bill and Ted (and we can’t forget Rufus).
room_address: 6751 N. Sunset Blvd, E-108 Glendale, AZ 85305 (Show on map)

review: I've been to a couple of escape rooms, and really I've been lucky enough to have a great time at all of them, and this one is no exception.  I did their "Pawn Shop" room, which was lots of fun and I would consider pretty difficult - but in fairness most of the difficulty came from us overthinking the problems.  ;)  It's run by a husband and wife that are very passionate about it - and even go so far as to make the different gadgets in the rooms - any place that casually mentions doing things with Arduino's gets an automatic bonus from me.Overall a great location and a great place to take a date, family or company to do something a bit more memorable an interactive than just going out for drinks or a movie.  Can't wait to go try their next one...
room_title: Escape room "Pawn Shop" by ESCAPE:chandler in Phoenix
room_description: Description:Brad thought his luck had changed when he found an expensive laptop sitting in the backseat of his Uber. He decided to take it to a local pawn shop to make some quick cash. While out with his friends celebrating his new fortune, the real owners tracked him down. They tell Brad that there is over $2 million in stolen diamonds hidden inside that computer and Brad has exactly one hour to get it back… or else!

review: Our family had a birthday party here.. it was so much fun!! It was my first time at an escape room. The owners were a blast and really made the night fun. We did the Pawn shop room and barely made it out with seconds to spare. We can't wait to go back!

review: I've been to several escape rooms now, & this is by far the BEST!  The atmosphere is amazing- it doesn't look "decorated" as much as it feels like you get transported into the experience!  Everyone in our group was constantly needed, to help/search/solve the entire time- and the 12 & 14 year old in our group figured out things that the adults couldn't!  This escape room was a BLAST, you don't want to miss it!

room_description: Description:The line of the great ancient pharaohs has been broken for centuries due to the jealousy of the gods. They have damned you from the afterlife and therefore caused you to live in a state of limbo for centuries. With the help of Ra, your powers have been restored so you can once again complete an offering to him and restore your place in the afterlife. Arise lost ones... your time to rule again has come.
room_address: 7257 S Atwood #103 Mesa, AZ 85212 (Show on map)

review: You have not been to an escape room until you’ve tried Return of the Pharaohs! The room is incredible. I felt like I was in an Egyptian tomb. The puzzles all went along with the theme and the attention to detail will blow you away. I can’t wait till their other rooms are finished.

review: Amazing experience!! First we started with the hangover. Hard but not too hard. It is for 7 people so if you do not have 7 they will fill in the spaces. Something the website didn’t explain clearly. However, we had a great couple that played the game with us and we had a wonderful time. Then we switched to the VR side. I do have to mention it is not in the same building. So do not book these too close together. We did the ocean Osiris. It was fantastic!!!! The staff helps you so you dont feel lost. We ended our night with the hospital horror. This is not an escape room, it was an “experience”. I was so submerged in my experience that I,... kind of forgot it wasn’t real. I screamed and took off my headset. My greatest fear was in that room and it felt too real to deal with it lol when I tapped out the staff was right by my side with smiles. They made me feel comfortable and supported. I came we’re with my husband and 2 older teens. We ABSOLUTELY recommend his location to EVERYONE.
room_title: Escape room "Depths Of Osiris VR" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
room_description:
Description:Dive deep underwater, repair the underwater capsule, transform into an alternate underwater universe and escape before you run out of air.

Defend yourself against sharks and decipher the secrets of the underwater temple. Welcome to Oceanus 5 deep sea platform. Our team of deep sea archaeologists has been at a loss for months searching for the lost Temple of Osiris. That's why we called your team to help us access the temple and locate the rumored artifact. You have the limited reserves of oxygen, the meter on your right wrist lets you know how much time you have left.
room_address: 7000 E Mayo Blvd #1030 Phoenix, AZ 85054 (Show on map)

review: My wife Sherrie and I along with our Scottsdale friends Mike and Lynette had the best time at Escape 101 in Phoenix. If you are searching for fun at a great price, with great service and team/friend building go to Escape 101. We did the Depths of Osirus and the Hospital of Horrors vitual reality rooms. So much fun we will go back for more. You won't be disappointed. Sean was out guide. Have fun

review: My friends and I love Mesa Escape Room! We have escaped a lot of rooms and our favorites were Dollhouse, Carnevil, and Frosty! Big part of why those were favorites was our game master Kesiah who is the absolute best! Can’t wait to escape again!

review: We completed this room with approx 20-ish minutes on the clock. We are a group of 6 that have completed about 10-15 rooms. We do not think the difficulty rating on this one is appropriate. I would say it's medium difficulty, bordering on easy.It was unique to be split up with your group. It was a fun room and concept even though we felt like it was a little bit easy.Also, finding the spot is a little difficult. It's kind of hidden on the side of the road with a high rolling fence at the entrance to the parking lot.

room_description: Description:It's up to you to rescue them. You know who we are talking about...

review: This was really fun. You definitely need a diverse group of friends to do the wild west! It's a fun challenge and we has 12 minutes to spare!
room_title: Escape room "Kidnapped" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
room_description: Description:It's up to you to rescue them. You know who we are talking about...
room_address: 1638 S 7th St, Phoenix, AZ 85034 (Show on map)

review: This our first experience with an escape room. Did it with two other couples on date night. Had a blast! We did the kidnapped room. It was a lot of fun, and we were able to escape from the room with nine minutes left, without any hints. Our wives were taken into a separate room and we had to rescue them and then continue all together. Don't want to give any too many details, but it was fun and challenging. The hardest part was that they didn't really tell us anything from the beginning. We just had to figure out what we needed to do. You get locked in a room with no instructions except to get out. A lot of fun, would totally recommend for groups of friends or team building activities for businesses. I was a little worried that you would have to be a genius puzzle solver. The puzzles/riddles/challenges were clever, but solvable. Thanks for a great evening PanIQ Room staff!
room_title: Escape room "Kidnapped" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
room_description: Description:It's up to you to rescue them. You know who we are talking about...
room_address: 1638 S 7th St, Phoenix, AZ 85034 (Show on map)

review: Had a great time! A group of 6 of us went and it was neat that all of us contributed to our escape! I definitely recommend! Can't wait to try the other rooms!

The after action talk is as fun as the room. We'll be back soon.

The clues are great and so varied that everyone will be able to add something. Loved loved loved it! We will be back soon to be kidnapped!

review: The room was pretty well done although I thought it was a little too dark. We did have a flashlight and a lantern, though. The puzzles were a little too easy (all of us had only done one or two rooms before). I wish the timer appeared in all of the rooms, but it was only visible in the first room. We could only communicate to the game master through a walkie talkie, which was unexpected. Sometimes it was a little challenging to understand them. I think the room used its space well, and we only ever felt too crowded in the first room (with 6 people). We did end up finishing with over 20 minutes. I think everyone still had a good time.

review: We did the Wild West room on a double date and it was so much fun! We were talking about it the rest of the weekend. We can't wait to go back and try another challenge.

review: THIS WAS AWESOME! My husband, mom (visiting from out of town) and I did this on a free evening we had together because we had all heard of escape the rooms and wanted to do one. We wanted to do this as a bonding activity but also because all three of us enjoy good challenges. Typically, my mom and my husband are competitive and I'm the one telling everyone "it's only a game, calm down!" However, by the end, I was cursing (I don't curse) and getting frustrated as a completive side I never see in myself was coming out. We failed the room, going over our 60 minute time by 3 minutes or so. It IS challenging doing the room with only 3 people (as it says on their website) partially because there were times when my husband and mother were solving a clue in one part of the room and meanwhile I was trying to solve a clue on my own in the other corner. Time is of the essence and the more minds working together, the better. However, it is by no means impossible to do this with only two or three people.We did the Wild West room and we felt like this was a good challenge level for us since this is our first escape room (we've heard that at PanIQ, the Kidnapping room is the most challenging with the Alien room being a close second). We would have finished the room in time (I imagine) but we didn't realize it was "okay" to ask for hints. Although the lovely woman working there told us we could, we figured that a) that was "cheating" and b) we were going to escape this room ourselves, gosh dernit! In the future, we will phone in a few times and ask for hints...! So again, this location is not "too tough" to complete as some other puzzle rooms I've seen reviews of in the Phoenix area. They want you to have fun! We will definitely be coming back with more family and friends in the future. It was SUCH a blast! We will be talking about this for a long time afterward.
room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
room_description: Description:You and your fellow outlaws have been locked into a jail cell in the Wild West. The Sheriff is out for a ride and left his key in his room. Now's your time to escape!

review: What a unique experience. My brother got locked up with his wife (a great idea, btw), and I got to save her (and him). Da da da da! We were the heroes! We asked if we could leave him, but just like the forest: "Pack it in, pack it out...don't litter". The staff was friendly and considerate. We needed a LOT of clues! It really requires community and communiction-which the world needs more of. It was good, wholesome, and great fun. Thanks, PANIQ Room Phx!!!

Everyone had a blast and was talking about how they wanted to do the other rooms with their other friends and family. I will most definitely be going back to do the Alien room.

review: First time doing a panic room. We went with a group of 6 friends. At first I wasn't sure how I felt about being locked in a room for an hour, but it was a lot of fun working together to escape with only our own ingenuity. The time seem to pass quickly as we were racing the against the clock to solve the series of puzzles that would enable us to escape. I thought it was great! Especially with friends. Would be fun to do with a group of friends, family or team building for work. Grab a coupon and go check it out. Now I want to try all the rooms!

review: AMAZING!!!! By far the best Escape rooms out there! Great friendly family owned. Any questions you have they always answer for you. I've done all the rooms. The newest "Kate's Motel" Extremely thought out and fun. Totally makes you feel like your in a real Motel. 10 star plus!!! Sending all my friends and family to try their rooms.
room_title: Escape room "Kate's Motel" by ESCAPE:chandler in Phoenix
room_description:
Description:Recently, a series of unusual events has been occurring over at Kate's Motel.  You and your group of  detectives have been tasked to unravel the mystery before others disappear.  You must be quick about it because Kate, or one of her sinister personalities, will be back soon.  If she catches you, you'll suffer the same gruesome fate as the rest of Kate's recent guests! 

You have 90 minutes to solve the mystery of Kate's Motel...or you won’t be checking out in your lifetime!
room_address: 312 N Alma School Rd, Suite 9, Chandler, AZ 85224 (Show on map)

review: My husband and I recently did Escape Room 101's newest room-The Chocolate Factory. This was our first game since doing 3 lackluster rooms in Socal. We were not disappointed. Lots of puzzles and games to stimulate the "little grey cells". Our gamemaster was Sean who, as always, was a great clue giver. He made our visit fun and worthwhile. (Thx, Sean!) The room was family friendly, bright, colorful and fun. After the experience, we signed up to do the VR escape room for my husband's birthday next month. We can't wait! We highly recommend this business as "must-do" to locals and travelers alike.
room_title: Escape room "Chocolate Factory" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
room_description: Description:You have been invited to the Great Chocolate Factory!!! The world is thrilled when the great candy and chocolate maker announces that a handful of Golden Tickets granting access to his factory are to be found in his chocolate bars! You have found one of the Golden Tickets and the day has come to take The Chocolate Factory Tour.  Will you resist the temptation to steal the top secret recipes? Come find out.
room_address: 7000 E Mayo Blvd #1092 Phoenix, AZ 85054 (Show on map)

review: We spent the evening escaping from the Houdini room! My team of seven were warmly welcomed to a clean and friendly lobby. Our game master Janey was fun and professional! When we beat the room record she was excited with us. The overall experience was awesome! The room itself was a 9/10 difficulty and it was pretty complex. We’re fairly experienced escapists and this room was truly difficult. I totally recommend Puzzling Escape!
room_title: Escape room "Becoming Houdini" by Puzzling Escape in Phoenix
room_description:
Description:For generations, Harry Houdini’s escapes have astounded audiences. From handcuffs to straitjackets, there seemed to be no method of restraint that could defeat the legendary escape artist. Some have said that even death itself was no match for Houdini’s spirit.
In this tribute to the world’s most famous escape artist, you will find puzzles, clues, magical secrets, and some facts about Houdini you may not have known. You will witness some magic take place, and you may even perform some magic yourself.
Some say the spirit of Houdini embodies this very room. If you hear some inexplicable noises, or feel a slight breeze caress your cheek, decide for yourself whether it’s your imagination, or if Houdini is trying to perform the ultimate escape.
room_address: 1925 S Sossaman Rd #211 Mesa, AZ 85209 (Show on map)

review: Took my sister here and we did the VR- Hospital of Horrors experience. It was AMAZING! Staff is so friendly, and was extremely helpful. Will definitely be back!
room_title: Escape room "Hospital of Horror VR" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
room_description:
Description:Walk the halls of an abandoned hospital - but watch out, you never know what's around the next corner.
Through the power of virtual reality, anything is possible.

You'll put on your VR headset and backpack and be transported to the Hospital of Horrors. You and your friends will walk around the abandoned rooms and ride the elevator, but watch out, you're not alone.
room_address: 7000 E Mayo Blvd #1030 Phoenix, AZ 85054 (Show on map)

review: So, I did not escape this room :(. However, despite my failure I have to rate this 5/5 because it was phenomenal. This is the hardest room they have and by FAR the hardest room I've ever done. I truly felt that I lost this room fairly and squarely (and I don't say this often lol). Before starting this room, you have a choice of picking it in difficult mode and of course being with fellow avid players, they chose the HARDEST MODE. That was our first mistake. I probably wouldn't pick the hard mode unless you had at least 5 people all of whom have done 20-30+ rooms. This was a true v4 room with little to no keys/locks. Lots of puzzles to solve and definitely a lot of puzzles that I have NEVER SEEN and was WOW'd once clue master explained it to us. This room put lots of different skills to the test and made us quickly realize our weaknesses. I highly recommend this room!
room_title: Escape room "The Painter's Collection" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
room_description: Description:The local painter is accused of practicing witchcraft by the villagers of the nearby town. They attack the poor man and unleash a power they could have never imagined. Unbeknownst to them, his young daughter an aspiring painter herself is the true witch. She was able to capture her father's soul within one of her paintings in order to keep him close-by. To avenge her fathers' attack, the young witch has begun luring people into her home - trapping their souls into her paintings for all eternity - proving evermore that every decision comes with consequences.
room_address: 2710 W Bell Road, Suite 1200, Phoenix, AZ 85053 (Show on map)

review: Would recommend if you have kids or novice players. Avoid if you have escape room connoisseurs. 5/5 for room design - it sets the mood for a break in. 1/5 puzzle difficulty - most of the puzzles were ultra easy to figure out. I could be that I'm a little more experienced and should have opted for a more challenging room. (We were out in less than 20 minutes, so understandably, I didn't feel like we received our money's worth).

review: My friends and I had a fantastic time playing the Trap room. At first, the room doesn't look like there is enough going on to keep us busy for a whole hour. But as you start playing, you find out that the clues are complicated but fantastic and just the right amount of challenging.  We had a fantastic time and the staff was great.  I would definitely do it again.
room_title: Escape room "The Trap" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
room_description: Description:You are the unexpected victims of a Madman’s twisted plan to make a game out of watching you try and escape his house of horrors. You will all have to work together solving the riddles and puzzles he has left for you scattered throughout his domicile. You will have to use all of your wits and cunning if you ever want to see your families again. So I’ll ask you one more time: “Do you want to play a game”?

review: We did the DaVinci room and it was a great experience. We thought the room could have been a little better decorated to give more of a moody feel to it. The clues were great and we liked that there were a few red herrings, it fit with the theme. We found the holy grail with 1:51 left on the clock.

review: My daughter and her friends did The Da Vinci room for her 15th birthday. This room was great for teenagers who had never tried an escape room before. The staff at Baffled were extremely friendly and helpful. Our group was very pleased and we are happy we chose Baffled for her birthday!

room_title: Escape room "The Secret Gallery (Quest to the Forbidden Temple)" by Dynamic Escape Rooms in Phoenix
room_description: Description:CHAPTER 1: THE SECRET GALLERY It's said that the legendary mystical stones of the Forbidden Temple have been lost for over two centuries. Word has reached you that nefarious multi-billionaire and self-proclaimed genius Prof. Hans Grubber has acquired a couple of them. You suspect he is hiding them in a secret gallery located under his most remote mansion. Your mission won’t be easy. You and your team must break into the mansion, gain access to the gallery and recover the sacred stones. Connect all the dots to outsmart Grubber's evil genius and steal back the sacred objects that will put you one step closer to the Forbidden Temple.
room_address: 1797 W University Dr, Suite 168, Tempe AZ 85281 (Show on map)

review: It was very fun! We really enjoyed the experience. The only thing I would change is the rooms need something else like background music or something to add more pressure to it besides the timer. But we will be back to try the other rooms! We did the quest for the throne.
room_title: Escape room "Quest for the Throne" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
room_description:
Description:You are the elder sibling born into a Royal family. It was your birthright to inherit the throne upon the King’s death, but an evil secret plan executed by your younger brother and some corrupt castle guards has left you exiled from the kingdom.
Disguised as a pauper, you’ve managed to make it back to the castle undetected, and with your knowledge of the secret passages in the castle, you’ve made it into the King’s Study. In the next sixty minutes, you need to find proof of your birthright and escape undetected before the castle guards return.
room_address: 12 N. Center Street, Suite 200 Mesa, AZ 85201 (Show on map)

review: Absolutely LOVED every minute. Engaging, fun, interactive and great decor which transports you to the era you're in, plus amazingly thought out clues! It was so much fun!!!. My teenage son wouldn't stop talking about It! Hats off to you for this amazing venue. I wish you the very best!! So much fun, I'm already thinking of a next date night!

review: The bank heist room was nice because it involved more props and physical activity than just writing down numbers and opening locks. The decorations were also great. Way too small for 12 people though, and a bit hot inside the room.
room_title: Escape room "Western Bank Heist" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
room_description: Description:Join the privileged ranks of the most notorious thieves of all time! Break into the Western Bank, figure your way around the security system and steal as much as you can!

review: Meets the excellent standard of a great escape room. We did the Western Bank Heist with a group of 8. Apparently their hardest room! We had a good flow going, but for anyone you needs it you can get hints - of course their eyes and ears are on you the entire hour. Really cool system - one of the mirrors actually doubled as a TV for typed hints. With a little boost on the most embarrassing ones to miss, we were able to get out with less than five minutes to spare!

review: To be honest, I had never heard of this concept before they opened this location. I went there with my family and we did the "Cashout" room. (It was difficult but we had a lot of fun).We were welcomed and guided by Nick and Ben, who did a wonderful job. They were both extremely friendly and very helpful. They answered our many questions in a very professional way.It was a great experience and I look forward to going back there and trying another room.
room_title: Escape room "Cashout" by Gilbert Escape Room in Phoenix
room_description: Description:Your elite squad is being interviewed for a very special mission. Your prospective employer has a test for you in his private Vegas lounge, you must solve each step of his challenge and retrieve a precious gemstone that he keeps on display. It got everyone in the group thinking and it was a fun family activity.

room_title: Escape room "Caskwerks & Capone" by Paradox Escape Room in Phoenix
room_description:
Description:The year is 1928, the height of prohibition, and you… are the right-hand man of the greatest bootlegger the world has ever known… Al Capone.
For the last few years, your gang has been raking in the big bucks and living the high life. But lately, you’ve been facing increasing opposition, primarily from rival gangs, the FBI and the most determined prohibition agent in the country… Elliot Ness.
The authorities are getting dangerously close to uncovering your whereabouts and distribution locations so Capone has gone into hiding. You’ve been tasked with continuing operations from your underground speakeasy hideout while he lays low. But, you’ve just been informed by an agent on the take that they’re closing in on you.
Now you need to shore up your operations, gather all the intel from the agent you have on the inside and escape to another hideout before time runs out.
room_address: 7 E Palo Verde St #9 Gilbert, AZ 85296 (Show on map)

review: It was a great time! I went for a team building event for work and can’t wait to go back with the family!

review: I did Caskworks and Capone with a friend. It was my first time only having two people solving the clues. It was fun and I really enjoyed the set up of the room. It looked like a speakeasy. I think we would have solved faster with one more person but we made it out with 19 seconds to spare! The hints are good and we didn't need to use any clues, which cost time. This one was also cool because you start in a dark room and have to figure out how to turn on the lights! Not totally dark, but you definitely need to get the lights figured out first.

Description:Your parents have gone out for dinner and left your uncle to babysit you. You love when your uncle babysits because he’s fun and playful, not to mention good at making awesome puzzles and booby traps!
Your little sister has always needed her toy monkey with her to fall asleep. To play a trick on you and your sister, your uncle hid Monkey somewhere in your playroom. Now your bedtime has passed, and if your parents find you awake when they come home, you’ll be in big trouble. Find the missing Monkey toy before your parents get home in 45 minutes!

review: My friends wanted to do a girls night here. When you book the room, you have the option of booking it individually for that room. When we arrived, I guess someone else also booked the room, so he joined our girls night. lol. So there was a total of 5 of us. We ended up doing the Collector room. We were definitely advised that it was a very difficult room, which they were definitely right about that. You have to figure out a lot of combinations to open some locks. There is also some math involved, so bring someone who is good at math. I think it was a fun experience, the only thing I didn't like is if you ask for a clue then they take some time off of your clock. I've been to two other Escape rooms and I've never heard of that. They give you pretty good hints, so I don't think you'll need the clues, however we still did. lol. We were able to make it out with 4 minutes to spare!
room_title: Escape room "The Collector" by Paradox Escape Room in Phoenix
room_description:
Description:You and your team at the crime lab have been on the case of the serial killer that’s been terrorizing the town of Gilbert for the last three years. All of the evidence points back to a house just down the street from the lab. But you’ve been there and searched the house from top to bottom and haven’t been able to find anything to help identify the killer.
You enter the house when suddenly you hear the noise of the front door shutting and locking behind you catches your attention. A nervous feeling begins to rise in the pit of your stomach as you realize that if you don’t get out soon, the next victim…will be you.
room_address: 7 E Palo Verde St #9 Gilbert, AZ 85296 (Show on map)

review: This is the first time we have been to this particular escape room, and we chose to do The Collector room. It was definitely a challenging one, but it was worth trying to do. I've been to other escape rooms, and this one is a little different when it comes to hints. The first hint will cost you 1 minute, the 2nd one 3 minutes, and the third one 5 minutes. They had a television in the room with the timer, and this particular room had some higher-tech type puzzles. We had a good time there and would definitely go back to try the other rooms. Thanks to the staff for your enthusiasm and professionalism.

review: We just went to this escape room with 4 people in our group and it was amazing! We went to other escape rooms as well but this one was our favorite. We tried The Collector. I would definitely recommend going with a bigger group because this was the hardest room! We were the first group to try this room(literally finished the room two minutes before we showed up) and although we did not make it, the two guys running the room were very helpful with guiding us. I would 10/10 recommend this place. They are very accommodating and the staff was super friendly!

review: My boyfriend and I are escape room enthusiasts and North Valley Escape Room continues to surpass our expectations with every new room they open! We have done all of their rooms, most recently doing their Big Top Circus. Their circus room is amazing! Seriously, I cannot say enough good things about this room. It is now in my top five favorite rooms (we've done 121 total so far to give you a comparison). It is very aesthetically-pleasing and the puzzles are very clever, well-themed and challenging. All of their other rooms are very well done, too. One thing that sets North Valley apart from some other local escape room places is their employees. They are personable, fun, helpful and have a genuine passion for escape rooms and talking to others that do as well. Their clue system is very fluent and doesn't lead you in the wrong direction and they are quick to deliver them when needed. We love North Valley and can't wait for their next room to open because they never disappoint. There is a lot of heart that goes into their rooms and it definitely shows. Keep up the great work and keep wowing us with whatever comes next.
room_title: Escape room "Big Top Circus" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
room_description: Description:Frederick the Great's wand is missing. The circus cannot go on without the magic show. Help Ziggy the Clown and his friends from the Freak Show to find the magic wand and save the day. You will find lots of fun and magic along your adventure. Truly an escape room like no other.
room_address: 42302 N Vision Way, Suite 104, Anthem, AZ 85086 (Show on map)

review: We did ZZ's Big Top Circus but failed and probably needed a few more minutes. It was really thought out and well done and lots of riddles, puzzles and locks, but it was linear so we couldn't work on different puzzles/riddles individually. We had to ask for quite a few clues since some of them were a bit difficult. There were multiple rooms and it was fun seeing each themed room. I can't wait to try The Great Outdoors next time!
room_title: Escape room "Big Top Circus" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix

review: This place is absolutely top-notch when it comes to escape rooms. We've done and made it out of three of the rooms (Big Top Circus, The Great Outdoors, and Alcatraz). We even did two in one day because we couldn't get enough! I've been through a few other rooms, and NVER really knows how to serve up an immersive, detailed experience for all involved. We'll definitely be returning to try all of the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Gravitational Effect" by International Room Escape AZ in Phoenix
room_description: Description:You and your friends were returning home from a long night of stargazing. As you were beginning to discuss what is beyond the stars, your vehicle is struck by a blinding white light. Everything becomes blurry, and your group passes out. When you awaken you are in a strange environment. Something out of this world has put you here. Is this a test? An experiment? You feel your body becoming heavier and heavier, as if gravity itself is changing. Can you and your team solve the otherworldly riddles and puzzles and escape this strange 4th dimension?
room_address: 1166 S Gilbert Rd #105 Gilbert, AZ 85296 (Show on map)

review: Awesome experience, very fun game! Thank you! We can't wait to come back for Amazon rainforest!

review: Gravitational Effect - I think I liked this room better than Amazon Rainforest. They tried to make the room 4D by giving you 3D glasses to enhance the experience but, let's be honest, they're not going to do anything other than make you trip and/or make the puzzles difficult because you can't see them straight. They are not needed to play the game so they are pretty pointless, in my opinion. We didn't even put them on. For the most part, the puzzles made sense and a few were challenging but not overly difficult. There were a couple of puzzles I felt that if they were improved upon they would make the experience more immersive. One of the puzzles involved "jackets" which, at first, we thought were just plastic bags. This made the puzzle seem kinda cheesy because they were just cheap rain ponchos that didn't really fit with the room. Perhaps investing in some actual jackets to make it more themed would help spruce up this puzzle some. The other puzzle was the final puzzle. I don't want to give anything away so I won't say anything about it other than it had absolutely nothing to do with the theme of the room. But even with that being said, I do want to say that there was one "puzzle" that was more of a physical challenge and that was a lot of fun. It caught us off guard when we saw it (which is almost always a good thing in the world of escape rooms) and we laughed a lot through it. I thought it was great for them to have this in the room and really added a lot to the experience.
room_title: Escape room "Gravitational Effect" by International Room Escape AZ in Phoenix
room_description: Description:You and your friends were returning home from a long night of stargazing. As you were beginning to discuss what is beyond the stars, your vehicle is struck by a blinding white light. Everything becomes blurry, and your group passes out. When you awaken you are in a strange environment. Something out of this world has put you here. Is this a test? An experiment? You feel your body becoming heavier and heavier, as if gravity itself is changing. Can you and your team solve the otherworldly riddles and puzzles and escape this strange 4th dimension?
room_address: 1166 S Gilbert Rd #105 Gilbert, AZ 85296 (Show on map)

review: I've been to this place twice and love it! I recently did suspects and boy was there a twist on that room, but also did bookie! Fantastic place and one of the best escape rooms that I've been to. Def worth the money and I highly recommend seeing if there is a groupon, then call and ask them for the same deal and they will give it to you! More money in their pockets and you still get a great deal. Jack was our control master and he had fun with us as well, sending celebratory messages on the screen when we would get the next clue unlocked. Can't wait to go back, already scheduled my next adventure 3/2... doing captains quarters :)

room_title: Escape room "Space Station Tiberia VR" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
room_description: Description:You are located on a space station Tiberia, the station protects the earth from the meteorites. Due to the heavy radiation storm various systems have failed. The largest meteor humanity has ever encountered is enroute to Earth. It will be impacting the Space Station in very soon and will end all life on our planet. Your goal is to restore the functionality of the station before it happens. After docking, you must re-activate the critical internal systems before moving to the outside of the station to repair the anti-meteor laser. Step into outer space in Space Station Tiberia. You can also virtually experience zero gravity and amazing panoramic views from the orbit.

review: I went back and tried the VR room, the space room. Absolutely incredible. I have done VR before, oculus and Samsung vr, but not like this where you can walk around and see the other people in your group. If you have never tried it, you definitely need to. VR is so futuristic and needs to be supported.The space escape room itself want too hard... It honestly seemed like it was designed for kids. However it was just plain fun! You can pick things up and throw them around the space station, which just doesn't seem to get old. Escaping the room was almost secondary to the fun space elements.We got out pretty quick and they were nice enough to let us see the horror hospital VR walk through, which was... Interesting.Anyway, based on others reviews here for the physical escape rooms, try them at your own risk. But the VR rooms just seem plain fun.

review: Unfortunately I can't give this escape room a good review. I've participated in 40+ escape rooms in the Phoenix area and this room was by far my worst experience out of all of them. On the plus side, the room was very well decorated and the experience was immersive, however the train car motion actually caused some pretty moderate nausea with no way to turn it off until the first puzzle was solved. The remaining portion of the room had a set of adequate puzzles, but then 2 longer puzzles that were simply annoyingly tedious, it never felt like we achieved anything when solving the puzzles.We didn't escape the room, however in similar situations in other rooms we have enjoyed laughing about where we made mistakes and how we could do better and appreciating the design of the puzzles - this room only left us frustrated and annoyed.These complaints are probably causes or magnified by the fact that, from our perspective, our GM was either ignoring our group, and the clues we did receive seemed to be lacking or were significantly delayed from when we did ask for help.Considering the premium cost of these rooms, we will unfortunately not be returning to finish their other rooms unlike the dozen or other companies that we have "cleared out". I really had such high expectations and never have been so disappointed with an escape room.

review: This is an AWESOME way to spend an evening!  Played the time travel room first and had so much fun with Braden as our game master that we came back the next night to play the boogie room!  This as with any escape room, some things in the room didn't always work as planned and Braden did such a good job making sure it didn't trip us up.  Plus, when we got stuck and asked for one of our 3 "free" clues, he was great at giving us just the right push to get past what was blocking us.  Disco was super challenging, with clues that weren't logical to find, we definitely needed all 3 freebies plus our extra 10 minutes & clues.  But loved the multi-room adventure!

review: We did The Dig and Jurassic Escape. Both werr great! Ive never done these before and was honestly blown away with how smart the puzzles were. The only complaints I have is both were for 10 people ( our party had 5) and it felt like 10 was way too many people. In both rooms it really felt like maybe 4 or 5 clear leaders took the reigns, 3 people helped and at least 2 people were completely useless and either got in the way or stood in the corner probably not enjoying themselves. The rooms really should be capped at 8. Also there should be an option to book a room as adults only or kid friendly. I can see for adults who've paid the money and are really into doing the puzzles, having to let little Timmy unlock the box or push the buttons or have a turn reading clues is just obnoxious and ruins the experience they played for. There should be like Escape the Room Junior for kids (of appropriate age) so that anyone who books that knows what they are signing up for. Likewise, being the only kid in a group where you might mot know everyone in the party is awkward for the kid and really opens up the door to awkwardness if your kid isn't totally well behaved or is competing with random adults to solve a part of the puzzle.

review: Went with friends to the Jurassic Escape room. The quality of the room was fantastic. The sound effects, props, etc. I really enjoyed the storyline and found parts to be challenging. We were grouped with 5 other people, as the rooms accommodate groups up to 10. If you prefer to be with people you know, I'd recommend looking into it. The personalities of others you don't know can be overwhelming and squander the experience at times.Our room guide/host would offer assistance at times, but her timing was somewhat frustrating. I understand escaping the room isn't meant to be spoon fed, although timelier guidance would've been appreciated. Overall a fun night out and we'd consider coming back again.

review: I have done 21 one escape rooms with my fiance! We love them; we came here and played The Theater room, which was fun, and a little challenging. We recently came back to do OutBreak, which we knew was the hardest room, but this room is specifically meant as a money grab room, which I have played a few rooms like this, elsewhere; before! What I mean by that is the room is designed so you don't make it out, and they take your $100 bucks that is costed you to book it! There is a difference between challenging and just making it so hard that you spend the whole time on one set of puzzles starting at screens which hurt your eyes! I thought the concept of the room was awesome but the way the room was laid out, game wise was not good at all! This room in my opinion needs to be reworked; I will not becoming back here again, and I will not be doing another escape room in general, for a long time as this room left me with a very bad, and annoyed feeling, of being taken advantage of money wise! I can no longer recommend this place to anyone that I know or that asks me!

review: Did the FBI room with a team of friends from Arizona Camp Sunrise. review: Before coming, we were told from other friends that this establishment doesn't have great themes but the puzzles were okay.We would not recommend The Heist, there are much better rooms in the valley. 2 out of 5 for the theme, there was no story or continued theme, just a "find this item" to escape; needs some creative direction. The puzzles in the game could have been much better, most of them were arbitrary/unrelated to the game and a few were "time wasters". There were a 2 mechanics in the game that were neat and worked well. 3/10 for the puzzles (out of a higher number due to the quantity)The room just needs better direction, it has great potential to be much better but just was disappointed in the experience.

room_title: Escape room "International Thief" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
room_description:
Description:A genius engineer turned gem thief is on the loose. He's disappeared and left clues for his lover to find him. You must break into his private office and search through his maps, notebooks and travel memorabilia to find the plane ticket, cash and key he left behind. Using your sleuthing skills, you'll have 60 minutes to get through the room.
Upon request, the room can be modified for kids ages 8 to 13.
room_address: 406 N Church Ave Tucson, AZ 85701 (Show on map)

review: None of the eight of us had ever done an escape room. We had two 40 yo youngsters in the group; everyone needs youth!!! room_title: Escape room "Bank Robbery" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
room_description: Description:You are a group of well-informed thieves. It has come to your attention that the general manager of Tucson City Bank has a stash of diamonds hidden in his office. In the dark of the night, you managed to sneak into the bank and reached the office of the CEO's secretary. From there, you deactivated the alarm, but it will sound off in exactly one hour. If you get to the diamonds in time, you will be rich beyond your wildest dreams. Fail, and you will end your career behind bars.

room_title: Escape room "Bad Medicine" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
room_description: Description:You've been in an accident, unable to identify yourself, you are sent to Dr. Mzrahi for observation and holding. You quickly realize the doctor has ill intentions and become desperate to escape. Luckily for you, there's a nurse at the nursing station you can call for help, but she doesn't want to get caught. The doctor will return in 65 minutes and you better not be here!
room_address: 406 N Church Ave Tucson, AZ 85701 (Show on map)

review: Every time I come to Tucson, which is often, I do a room (or two!) at Ace of Escape, they are by far my favorite in Tucson. They have a wide variety of rooms, if you catch their Christmas room during the season, it's the best Christmas themed room out there. Very well thought out, not just another room with Christmas decorations. By far my favorite is Bad Medicine, super hard, but I love a challenge! They just opened a new two person room that I can't wait to check out - I've never done a room specifically made for two people. I have a feeling it's harder than it sounds.

room_description:
Description:For a thief, greatness is measured by the size of your take. You were the greatest back in your prime, a top class safecracker with a long history of perfect heists. But after many years in the game, you’ve since retired.
One fateful day, you get a phone call from an old partner in crime named Diego. Your target is the Giant National Bank Corp, the bank managers’ secretary, Gina had been quietly preparing the vault room for your heist. She left clues for you, but now it’s up to you to do what you do best. Assemble your team, crack the un-crackable safe, and fill your loot bag to the brim for the take of the century!
room_address: 3655 N Oracle Rd #102 Tucson, AZ 85705 (Show on map)

review: The serial killer room was a lot of fun! Creepy, challenging, and creatively put together. The staff were awesome as well - very entertaining and customer service oriented. We also noticed they have a lively game night at Will You Escape. Another reason to go back.
room_title: Escape room "Serial Killer" by Will You Escape? in Tucson
room_description:
Description:In recent months, numerous Local FBI agents have attempted to locate Agent Q. Although the FBI is jubilant on their success of finding their agent’s location, dozens of other agents have been mysteriously disappearing on a daily basis. With recent threats and the surfacing of the new age serial killer donned “The Rumpelstiltskin”, many questions continue to surround the ever-growing number of missing agents.
He now has you and 3 of your friends! In 45 minutes, he will return to commit his next gruesome crime. That is unless you can escape him!
Players will be blindfolded and possibly handcuffed.
room_address: 2577 North 1st Avenue Tucson, AZ 85719  (Show on map)

review: I've done quite a few escape rooms around the country in the last year and this one is definitely at the top of my list! Difficult but not impossible. review: Our family was looking for something fun to do out of the heat that we hadn't done before. This fit the bill. We got to work as a team to solve puzzles and escape the room. The 15 year-old had as much fun as the 9 year-old, and everyone begged to go solve another room as soon as we'd finished. Highly recommended. They even opened just so we could fit them in our trip!
room_title: Escape room "Beat the Clock" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
room_description: Description:Your eclectic Nana has been evicted from her apartment and her belongings are being repossessed. She collected lots of clocks and random items over the years, but there's only one item of value in her place; a family heirloom watch. You have 60 minutes to rummage through her apartment, turn the power back on, break into locks, and decode hidden symbols to find the watch before the repo man arrives and takes it all.
room_address: 406 N Church Ave Tucson, AZ 85701 (Show on map)

review: The best date night ever! We did the clocks room which was very fun!We are going back for more this weekend and bring more people to join in on the good times.Can't wait

room_description: Description:Another team of archeologists working an excavation in the Valley of Kings has disappeared. review: My favorite room in Tucson! The staff here is attentive and friendly, the Witching Hour has a spooky vibe and bewitching puzzles. I loved the secret reveal!
room_title: Escape room "The Witching Hour" by Will You Escape? in Tucson
room_description:
Description:You and your friends inadvertently wronged a witch and she has put a curse on you. You and your friends must break into her shop and retrieve the ingredients to a potion before the sun comes up in one hour. 

She will turn you into a frog if she finds you! Hurry the clock is ticking!
room_address: 2577 North 1st Avenue Tucson, AZ 85719 (Show on map)

review: Well organized and fun staff!! Bomb Squad was my first escape room and we loved it!! Daryl was great!
room_title: Escape room "Bomb Squad" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
room_description:
Description:You got the call, you’re responding, you’re told this is one of the most prolific bombs ever built and you have to disarm it. It’s massive, like nothing you’ve ever seen before. It could take out the entire city.
You enter the area, unfamiliar with the surroundings. You have to get to the bomb to save all of your fellow ‘Tucsonans’, but how do you get in there? Can you disarm it in time? Get your team together, get geared up and save your city, you only have 60 minutes.
room_address: 3655 N Oracle Rd #102 Tucson, AZ 85705 (Show on map)

review: I honestly feel like we just successfully defused a bomb hahahaha! I'd never done one of these before, and I'm ashamed to say I was not really expecting much. However, from the moment I set foot in the place, I knew it was going to be fun and challenging. The staff do a great job of teaching how to play, and really play their roles to make it feel "real". The owner puts a lot of TLC and expertise into her work building the rooms, and it shows. It's not at all cheesy like I kind of thought it might be. I was 10 minutes into my first puzzle and already wanted to do another one afterward. Go do it.
room_title: Escape room "Bomb Squad" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson

review: We did the Bomb Squad escape and had a great time. Out of our group of 7, 5 people were first-timers so this room's intermediate difficulty was a good fit.The owner has a lot of passion and enthusiasm for escapes, and it showed in the room. Lots of well-designed puzzles and activities with an overall high production value.I've done quite a few escapes and this is the first one where there was a human monitor or guide in the room. I think this takes away from the experience, so that would be my one criticism. Our guide jumped in too often without us asking for help.Other than that, great experience and worth the money! We're planning to visit again.
